alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued November 24 at 2:06AM PST until November 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf of 4-6 feet. Minor tidal overflow and coastal flooding possible. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...From late tonight through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor coastal flooding is possible during the morning high tides of 7.0 to 7.2 feet ranging from 708am on Saturday morning to 814am on Monday morning.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
